text.sentence: Telecommunications | U.S. Data Networking eight February two thousand sixteen
Ahead of the print, we are trimming estimates and lowering our price target to dollar twenty nine, down from dollar thirty one.
Despite a more cautious stance on the near term, we maintain our Overweight rating on Cisco.
In our view, the headwinds are explainable and not reflective of major execution or strategic challenges.
The bears could focus on the extra week in Apr Q masking underlying weakness, but we expect limited fuss as that topic has been increasingly noted.
Another driver is our research indicates Cisco's routing trend lines could be softer.
Our research indicates the typical nine twelve months lag from launch to new products hitting full stride could take a little longer this time.
In Ctwo thousand twelve two thousand fourteen, Cisco's routing growth meaningfully trailed the broader market.
We expect Cisco to trail again in Ctwo thousand fifteen due to large carrier platforms not hitting full stride until oneH Ctwo thousand sixteen.
The net impact is that we estimate Cisco to outpace the routing market in Ctwo thousand sixteen and then trail again in Ctwo thousand seventeen.
Our revised Jan Q revenue and EPS estimates decline by .six
As for Ctwo thousand sixteen, our revenue and EPS estimates fall by one.

While not moving in the direction we prefer, the magnitude of the cuts is not cause for alarm, especially given the pullback in the stock's and peer group's valuation metrics over the past forty five days.
While the macro blues could weigh in the near term, we continue to believe the networking market is on the right side of the cloud divide.
The cloud will hurt some sectors more than others over time and with more lasting impact than macroeconomic cycles.

While Cisco's LT revenue growth is likely to be only one three percent, low relative cloud displacement risk, a sturdy margin profile, and shareholder return make the stock a quality holding for industrials focused investors.

Cisco is our supertanker pick and ranks within the outer edge of the leadership quadrant in our relative Strength Quadrants.
We believe Cisco is a steady ship and represents an attractive industrialized tech play.
Potential factors that could drive upside include rebound in China, increasing contribution from subscription model, and diminished threats from cloud and white box.
Potential factors that could drive downside include further deterioration in China, lighter contribution from subscription model, and increased threats from cloud and white box.

Near term trends could be mixed due to routing cycles not hitting full stride
In recent years, Cisco's switching and routing revenue growth trend lines have de coupled from the broader market trend lines.
We expect the relative growth gaps to persist, and there could be potential widening in Cisco's routing business due to laggard effects of new carrier product cycles .
Our research indicates the typical nine twelve months lag from launch to new products hitting full stride could take a little longer this time.

Our VAR Networking surveys have been constructive on Cisco's switching business trends which is why our revised Y/Y growth rates continue to have Cisco's switching business trending within one hundred two hundred bps of estimated market growth.
In contrast, we expect a wider gap between Cisco's routing revenue growth and the broader market, ranging from fifty Â­ three hundred bps difference with Cisco trailing on average.

Y/Y growth percent in revenue Ctwo thousand twelve Y/Y Growth percent Market Switching Routing Y/Y Growth percent Cisco Switching Routing Ctwo thousand thirteen Ctwo thousand fourteen Ctwo thousand fifteenE Ctwo thousand sixteenE Ctwo thousand seventeenE
As illustrated in the above figure, in Ctwo thousand twelve two thousand fourteen, Cisco's switching revenue growth rates were one.four
For Ctwo thousand fifteenE two thousand seventeenE, we estimate Cisco switching growth of three.two
As for routing, in Ctwo thousand twelve two thousand fourteen, Cisco's routing revenue growth rates were .nine
For Ctwo thousand fifteenECtwo thousand seventeenE, though, we estimate Cisco routing growth of two.
We expect Cisco to trail the broader market in routing in Ctwo thousand fifteen due to its new product cycles not hitting full stride until oneH Ctwo thousand sixteen.
The net impact is that we estimate Cisco to outpace the routing market in Ctwo thousand sixteen and then trail again in Ctwo thousand seventeen.
Our revised Jan Q revenue and EPS estimates decline by .six
As for Ctwo thousand sixteen, our revenue and EPS estimates fall by one.

While not moving in the direction we prefer, the magnitude of the cuts is not cause for alarm, especially given the pullback in the stock's and peer group's valuation metrics over the past forty five days.
Our revised estimates are detailed below and we also introduce Ctwo thousand seventeen revenue and EPS estimates.

Our price target of dollar twenty nine, implying twenty seven percent appreciation from current levels, is based on our base case scenario .
Our revised Jan Q revenue and EPS estimates decline by .six
As for Ctwo thousand sixteen, our revenue and EPS estimates fall by one.
While not moving in the right direction we prefer, the magnitude of the cuts is not cause for alarm, especially given the pullback in the stock's and peer group valuation metrics.

Along with the broader market, Cisco multiples have compressed due to recent macro headwinds Â­ but we think that as fundamentals are determined not to be under major duress that Cisco's pre downdraft multiple will be restored in due time.

While the macro blues could weigh in the near term, we continue to believe the networking market is on the right side of the cloud divide.
The cloud will hurt some sectors more than others over time and with more lasting impact than macroeconomic cycles.

While Cisco's LT revenue growth is likely to be only one three percent, low relative cloud displacement risk, a sturdy margin profile, and shareholder return make the stock a quality holding for industrialsfocused investors.
In the below tables, we present the four steps behind our price target and the potential upside or downside scenarios.
In the first table, three P and L scenarios are presented, with our current estimates as the base case.
The worst case reflects a downside scenario, and the best case reflects an upside scenario.

In the second and third tables, implied stock prices for the worst, base, and best case scenarios are computed using a narrow band of EV/EBITDA and P/E multiples, which are close to historical averages.
We assign a probability of each scenario occurring, with the heavier weighting applied to the base case, since that captures our current estimates.
Finally, in the fourth table, the implied stock prices for each scenario are blended evenly to arrive at each scenario's price target.
The worst case and best case derived values are dollar twenty one and dollar thirty three, respectively.

dot com or call two hundred twelve thousand five hundred twenty six one thousand seventy two.

The Investment Bank's Research Department produces various types of research including, but not limited to, fundamental analysis, equity linked analysis, quantitative analysis, and trade ideas.

Recommendations contained in one type of research product may differ from recommendations contained in other types of research, whether as a result of differing time horizons, methodologies, or otherwise.

Risk Disclosure Master limited partnerships are pass through entities structured as publicly listed partnerships.
For tax purposes, distributions to MLP unit holders may be treated as a return of principal.
Investors should consult their own tax advisors before investing in MLP units.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Investment Bank of Barclays Bank PLC is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Below is the list of companies that constitute the industry coverage universe: U.S. Data Networking Arista Networks, Inc. Ffive Networks, Inc. Distribution of Ratings: Barclays Equity Research has one thousand eight hundred eighty five companies under coverage.

fifteen percent have been assigned an Underweight rating which, for purposes of mandatory regulatory disclosures, is classified as a Sell rating; forty three percent of companies with this rating are investment banking clients of the Firm.
Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Top Picks: Barclays Equity Research's Top Picks represent the single best alpha generating investment idea within each industry, taken from among the Overweight rated stocks within that industry.
Barclays Equity Research publishes global and eight February two thousand sixteen nine Brocade Communications Juniper Networks Cisco Systems, Inc.
regional Top Picks reports every quarter and analysts may also publish intra quarter changes to their Top Picks, as necessary.
While analysts may highlight other Overweight rated stocks in their published research in addition to their Top Pick, there can only be one Top Pick for each industry.
To view the current list of Top Picks, go to the Top Picks page on Barclays Live .
